details.title: Improvement of Automatic Landing Through the Use of a Space Diversity ILS Receiving System
details.abstract: A space diversity method of receiving and processing ILS localizer information has been developed and flight tested. Multiple lateral ly separated antennas are used which sense the ILS signal on and around the approach path. Combining these signals suppresses ILS beam distortion produced by multipath signal interference and provides much improved guidance information to the landing aircraft control system.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
